info.game_comments:
Maria Wenglinsky game 2.

(Sarah: Puppets take center stage, next on Jeopardy!)

(1, 1).clue: A former House speaker, John Bell ran as a third-party candidate in this last election year before the Civil War

(3, 1).clue: Mix egg whites, gin, lemon juice & grenadine & you get this colorful "lady"

(4, 1).clue: So your uncle killed Dad  & married Mom; I say stop brooding, get off your duff & kill your uncle!

(5, 1).clue: While vacationing in this city, you might stop by the Pere-Lachaise cemetery to pay your respects to Chopin & others

(1, 2).clue: William the Conqueror was crowned King of England in Westminster Abbey on Christmas Day in this year

(3, 2).clue: For breakfast, this dish of diced & fried potatoes goes well with just about anything

(4, 2).clue: You say you value your wife's love above "the sea's worth", but you gotta jack it up & see what she needs: it's trust!

(5, 2).clue: Saskatoon has a museum devoted to the culture of this former Soviet republic, the largest country entirely in Europe

(6, 2).clue: A plant also called checkerberry, or the oil made from it

(1, 3).clue: The Pilgrims who survived the first winter celebrated New England's first Thanksgiving in this year

(3, 3).clue: These cells can be monocytes, lymphocytes or neutrophils

(4, 3).clue: After being your own severed hand on a platter, I think killing Tamora & her sons was a cry for help, General

(5, 3).clue: Excursions are available from this largest Greek island to Santorini, which some call the "Lost Atlantis"

(6, 3).clue: A pilot who flies in position behind & to the side of the formation leader

(1, 4).clue: Reborn after 1,500 years, the first modern Olympic Games were held in Athens in this year

(2, 4).clue: A Rolling Stones lead singer's selections

(3, 4).clue: Sue Ellen Cooper, seen here, has the title of Exalted Queen Mother of this society

(4, 4).clue: Regan & Goneril got your inheritance, but you married the King of France; get over your daddy issues!

(5, 4).clue: The Hofbrauhaus in Munich was once the royal court brewery of this German state

(6, 4).clue: The poem "Invictus" says, "In the fell clutch of circumstance I have not" done this "nor cried aloud"

(1, 5).clue: The United Nations officially came into existence on October 24 of this year

(3, 5).clue: Mr. Haney always tried to sell stuff to the Douglases on this rural 1960s sitcom

(4, 5).clue: You're obese, gluttonous, lecherous, & you stabbed Hotspur's corpse; you either get it or you don't, & you don't

(5, 5).clue: About half of the visitors to this former Portuguese colony are mainland Chinese coming to gamble

(6, 5).clue: Chicago suburb on the shores of Lake Michigan

(1, 1).clue: Originally a term for a full-size sketch ready for transfer to a canvas or wall, it now refers to any humorous drawing

(2, 1).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew reads from the New Amsterdam Theatre, New York, accompanied by a large puppet bird and its puppeteer.) Julie Taymor & Michael Curry designed puppets like Zazu for this 1998 Tony-award-winning musicalZazu: "Say it!"

(3, 1).clue: Appropriately, a replica of the Doge's Palace can be found at this Vegas casino

(4, 1).clue: It was written over the first half of November 1863--not, as legend says, scribbled on a train ride

(5, 1).clue: In 1836 he bacame the first Secretary of State for the new republic of Texas

(6, 1).clue: Bedford Industries & Hanscom Inc. are 2 manufacturers of these plastic bag closers

(1, 2).clue: As in the work seen here, this technique often includes photographs

(2, 2).clue: Several puppets of different sizes "plant" themselves onstage as Audrey II in this musical

(3, 2).clue: Symbolizing Venice's dominance over land & sea, statues at the Doge's Palace depict Mars & this other Roman god

(4, 2).clue: "Strong at Home, Respected in the World" was the title of this 2004 Democratic Party document
(4, 2).correct response: The Platform for America (the Democratic Party platform accepted)

(5, 2).clue: In 1993 this British physicist made an appearance as himself on "Star Trek: The Next Generation"

(6, 2).clue: You blow into this device to tune a musical instrument

(1, 3).clue: This term usually refers to a binder of egg yolk thinned with water

(2, 3).clue: (Sarah pets a puppet lion cub in a cage in the Gershwin Theatre, New York.)  My cute little puppet friend lives here in the magical land of Oz, in this current Broadway musical

(3, 3).clue: Built around 1600, this Venetian bridge links the Doge's Palace with nearby infamous prisons

(4, 3).clue: Seen here are the signatures on an instrument of this, now housed in the National Archives

(5, 3).clue: "Camptown Races" is only one of the many popular songs written by this 19th century composer

(6, 3).clue: This term's original meaning was cash that a woman carries on a date in case she has to ditch her escort

(1, 4).clue: This type of work means "fresh" in Italian

(3, 4).clue: His movements constricted by law, a Doge spent much of his time at his palace complex & this nearby cathedral
(3, 4).correct response: the Cathedral of St. Mark (or San Marco)

(4, 4).clue: Poet Filippo Marinetti wrote a series of these declarations of principles for the Futurist art movement

(5, 4).clue: Elected to the U.S. Senate from Illinois in 1847, he advocated the annexation of Cuba

(6, 4).clue: If your hair color is Nice 'N Easy shade No. 87, you might be called this
(6, 4).correct response: a bottle blonde (or a bleached blonde)

(1, 5).clue: Borrowed from the German, it's a term for art exhibiting sentimental bad taste

(2, 5).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reads from Golden Theatre, New York.) Rick Lyon not only designed the puppets for this musical...Rick Lyon: "He also performs characters like me, Trekkie Monster!"

(3, 5).clue: In 697 A.D. Venice's legendary first Doge took office after independence was gained from this empire

(4, 5).clue: On Dec. 10, 1948 the U.N. General Assembly adopted it & called upon nations to display & disseminate it

(5, 5).clue: This character was James Joyce's fictional counterpart in "Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man" & "Ulysses"

(6, 5).clue: A record of every species seen & identified by a person in his or her birdwatching career

(0, 0).clue: This outlaw's father, a minister, gave him his first & middle names after an 18th century English clergyman
